title: What is the technology stack of Airbnb? - Quora

response.answer_text: Products in Airbnb’s tech stack include: Akamai, Amazon (CloudSearch, ElastiCache, RDS, Web Services, EC2, EBS), Android Wear SDK, AWS Lambda, Babel, Bootstrap, Bugsnag, Button, Clion, Datadog, Digicert, Driven, eNom Domain Registration, Folio, GitHub, Google (Cloud Messaging, Maps), HackerOne, Intelligent Platform, jQuery, Lightbend Reactive Platform, Librato, New Relic, nginx, PagerDuty, Phusion Passenger, Ruby on Rails, Sakurity, Sentry, Solano CI, Twilio, UserTesting, WordPress, Zencoder, and Zerigo DNS. Additionally, here’s a list of other software products that Airbnb is using internally: Marketing: Campaign Monitor, Criteo, Dragon Metrics, EmbedlySales and Support: Directly, Guru, Opentest, Streak,Product and Design: Asana, Freedcamp, Google Fonts, InvisionAnalytics: Apache Hadoop, Concurrent, Droplr, HeapHR: Cloudpeeps, Culture Amp, HackerRank, PiazzaFinance and Accounting: Braintree Payments, FundersClub, Payoneer, PayPalProductivity: Do, Envoy, EventBoard, HackPadFor a complete list of software used by Airbnb, check out Airbnb's Stack | Siftery (Disclaimer: I work at Siftery - the above data was pulled from Siftery and where possible has been verified by vendors or individuals working at Airbnb)

Despite the simplicity of the interface, Airbnb is a complex platform that combines numerous features. There are three types of profiles: guest, host, and admin. The functionality of the guest and host profiles is created according to their needs. So, I’ve just checked with Wappalyzer to know which technologies Airbnb uses.  As you can see, the main programming language is Ruby. The web framework is Ruby on Rails. JS framework is React. JavaScript Libraries - Moment.js. So, if you want to create a similar website to Airbnb, keep in mind the following programming languages that should be used: Technology Stack server-side: ElasticSearch, Grape, I18N [2 languages], PostgreSQL, Rack, Rails, Ruby, Sidekiqclient-side: CSS, HTML5, JavaScript, React.jstools (hosting, monitoring, etc.): Airbrake, AWS S3, BrowserStack, Codeship, Confluence, GitHub, Heroku, Slack, Swagger, Testrail, Youtrackintegrations: Intercom, Loco - Translation Management System, Pexip, SendGrid, Stripe, TwilioI hope I covered your question That’s it for now, folks) Check out: > How Much Does It Cost To Build A Website Like Airbnb?
